column4: If I want to start off the computer at command mode, should I change id:2:initdefault: to id:N:initdefault: in /etc/inittab file?
If I want to start off the computer at command mode, should I change id:2:initdefault: to id:N:initdefault: in /etc/inittab file?
for redhat linux it was id:5:initdefault for x-window and id:3:initdefault for command line ; but dunno for ubuntu
Ubuntu is debain based and doesnt use the concept of different runlevels
